channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Happy 75th birthday to Goodnight Moon! To celebrate, here is my pluralistic Jewish parody published in a Shma Purim issue a few years back. https://t.co/13WTcTtu7S

item.description: @Namer98 @DBashIdeas Many fond Shabbos memories of playing with my kid. What parents need to know is that underneath the infinite complexity it’s actually simple, and if you’re not playing competitively it’s both fun and easy.
item.source:markdown: @Namer98 @DBashIdeas Many fond Shabbos memories of playing with my kid. What parents need to know is that underneath the infinite complexity it’s actually simple, and if you’re not playing competitively it’s both fun and easy.

item.description:
@GilStudent I think of the economic interpretation as being a Louis Finkelstein thing — was it shared by Louis scholars?

item.description: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).
item.source:markdown: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).

item.description:
@MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.

@MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.

@MisfitTorah While the closest I came to reading Milton was hearing R Aharon z”l give a shiur once, I suspect the first strong defense of press freedom makes explicit reference to Tanakh. So there’s that.

@MisfitTorah The fact that Shmuel thinks the monarchy is a bad idea but implements it any way speaks to a lack of concern about the fine points of the constitution.
@liamsadams @reporterdeepa I know it’s not your doing, but it’s really annoying that my subscription to my local Gannett paper doesn’t get me through your paywall.
item.source:markdown: @liamsadams @reporterdeepa I know it’s not your doing, but it’s really annoying that my subscription to my local Gannett paper doesn’t get me through your paywall.

item.description:
@AD_Lobel Four entered the Yeshiva College Poetry Society in 1984/85……

@AD_Lobel Just to be clear: the first two categories don’t map onto the second two categories. One of the gay poets got semicha; the other was engaged to a woman. It was the 80s.
item.source:markdown:
@AD_Lobel Four entered the Yeshiva College Poetry Society in 1984/85……
@AD_Lobel Just to be clear: the first two categories don’t map onto the second two categories. One of the gay poets got semicha; the other was engaged to a woman. It was the 80s.
